wikipedia_page.main: Harvey Choun Lim (born 30 August 1967) is an English former professional footballer. A goalkeeper, he was a youth player with Norwich City, but never played for the first team. He went on to play for Gillingham as well as for teams in Sweden and Hong Kong. He subsequently moved to Whistler, British Columbia and opened an art gallery and picture framing studio.

link_mentions.page: List of outfield association footballers who played in goal
response: |Gillingham had already had David Crown dismissed when their goalkeeper Harvey Lim was sent off along with Blackpool's Andy Garner for fighting. Dunne was placed in goal, with manager Damien Richardson saying that his experience from playing gaelic football while growing up in Ireland would give him handling experience. Gillingham won the match 3–2, having been 2–1 up at the time Lim was sent off.
